data.name: Unsecured Variable Personal Loan
data.description: With a variable personal loan you’ll get a great rate and the flexibility to reach your goals sooner.

eligibility.additionalValue: Applications are for individuals and personal use purposes only

eligibility.additionalInfo: Applications for Personal Loans are subject to credit approval.
Loan amounts from $5,000 to $75,000 can be done online. For loan amounts less than $5000 and greater than $75,000, visit a branch.

features.additionalInfo: Wherever you are in the world, Great Southern Bank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Enjoy access to your additional  loan repayments with redraw, so you can use it whenever you need some breathing space.
No penalties for early payout, pay off sooner without being charged a fee.
Flexible repayment options - choose to make either monthly, fortnightly or weekly repayments to suit your income and budget.

fees.name: Arrears letter fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable where Great Southern Bank sends you a letter in relation to arrears on your account.

fees.name: Switch variation fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you request, and we agree to switch your personal loan product to another personal loan product.

fees.name: Account information fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you request the following: • an annual audit certificate on a Great Southern Bank account; or • a copy of a cheque or Visa voucher; or • personal information, traces, document copies (other than those specified above) and/or information pertaining to an account.

fees.name: Telegraphic transfer fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable where you request a local telegraphic transfer to an account at a financial institution within Australia.

fees.name: Establishment fee
fees.additionalInfo: An establishment fee includes the cost of processing the application and the preparation of loan documentation.

fees.name: Default notice fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable where Great Southern Bank sends you a default notice in relation to arrears or an over limit amount on your account.
